answers.answer: Please dont look up things online. It is always the worst case scenario.  I have spent several hours/days in fear because of the internet. ((Haha)). But im sure everything will be fine. I have never gone through this but im praying everything is okay. Its a great sign that the baby looks really healthy.
^^^ yes I know,  but I got curious and it killed the cat lol

Lol! My husband is a doctor-- he hates it when patients do their "research" online! They come in super paranoid and he has to calm them down or do all the tests they ask for just to give them piece of mind!Just relax and let your doctor do the worrying; )

With my 1st they thought I was having a 8 or 9lb baby because I was so big. Turns out I was all fluid. Had a 5.9lb baby! They didn't worry too much about it. I hag so much fluid the midwife got sprayed in face When she told me to push!!lol! Don't worry, I'm sure all is fine.  I'm on baby#3 too, I don't think the worrying ever ends!
Thanks!  ^^^ hope that's the case for me.
Aw, try to relax.  I've never really heard of this- sorry I can't help you there.  But I wish it continues to go well and it's nothing serious!  Congratulations on passing your glucose levels ;)
I had a lot of fluid but by about 36 weeks my levels started to drop. It's never been an issue for me just uncomfortable.
I just came from the doctors & I'm measuring 30 weeks and I'm 28 weeks I will be 29 weeks in 3more days.She told me not to worry unless I get bigger

question: So I passed my 1hr glucose test,  which I thought i would fail & I had an ultrasound because my uterus is measuring 2wks ahead.  Baby is well measuring on track for 27wks 2lb 4oz, but my uterus measures 29. Come to find out,  I have a lot of amniotic fluid.  Which could be caused by a number of things... since diabetes isn't the culprit, I now need blood tests and close monitoring with ultrasounds every so weeks. I really hope its nothing serious but I read online its called polyhydramnios & it sounds scary. Anybody been through/going through this?
title: Excessive Amniotic Fluid
